Vienna International Centre  
1400 Vienna, Austria  

---

### Executive Summary

**Introduction**  
CDGA Engineering Consultants Ltd is a leading provider of engineering solutions with a specialization in borehole rehabilitation and drilling services. With over 25 years in the industry, we have a proven track record of delivering complex projects successfully, particularly in the field of seismic monitoring infrastructure. Our mission is to provide innovative solutions while ensuring compliance with international standards and safety protocols.

**Key Services Offered**  
In response to RFQ No. 2024-108, CDGA proposes to undertake the rehabilitation of the existing borehole (LOT 1) and drilling a new borehole (LOT 2) in Senegal. Our services will ensure both borehole projects are completed to the highest standards, incorporating the latest in drilling technology and safety measures.

---

### Scope of Work

**Rehabilitation of the Existing Borehole (LOT 1)**  
- **Deliverables:** Cleaning, sealing, cementing of the borehole, and conducting a pressure test upon completion.  
- **Technical Details:** Utilize corrosion-resistant materials to ensure longevity and reliability.  
- **Compliance Requirements:** Adherence to all CTBTO technical specifications and Senegalese regulations.  
- **Execution Strategy:** Meticulous planning and execution with continuous project oversight to mitigate risks.

**Drilling of a New Borehole (LOT 2)**  
- **Deliverables:** Drilling of a new borehole designed for seismic instrumentation with permanent water-tight sealing.  
- **Technical Details:** Use of a corrosion-resistant stainless-steel casing and bentonite-based grouting.  
- **Compliance Requirements:** Compliance with international drilling standards and CTBTO guidelines.  
- **Execution Strategy:** Use advanced drilling technology to ensure precision and operational safety.

---

### Technical Approach & Methodology

**Step-by-Step Process**  
1. **Site Preparation:** Selection and approval of drilling sites, removal of debris, and site leveling.  
2. **Drilling & Rehabilitation:** Execution of drilling operations and comprehensive rehabilitation processes.  
3. **Quality Assurance:** Implementation of continuous testing and monitoring to ensure compliance with specifications.  

**Tools and Technologies**  
- Utilization of tri-cone rotary drills and advanced cementation methods.  
- Real-time data monitoring for precision in drilling operations.  

**Quality Assurance Methods**  
- Regular inspections and tests, including verticality, leak, and obstruction tests, as specified by CTBTO.

---

### Project Plan & Timeline

| **Milestone**                   | **Estimated Completion Date** |
|--------------------------------|-------------------------------|
| Site Preparation               | April 15, 2025                |
| Borehole Rehabilitation (LOT 1)| June 30, 2025                 |
| New Borehole Drilling (LOT 2)  | September 15, 2025            |
| Final Testing and Commissioning| October 15, 2025              |

*All project components are aligned with the CTBTO deadlines, ensuring timely delivery.*

---

### Pricing & Payment Terms

**Structured Cost Breakdown**  
- **LOT 1: Rehabilitation of Existing Borehole**  
  - Total Cost: €150,000

- **LOT 2: Drilling of New Borehole**  
  - Total Cost: €250,000

**Payment Terms**  
- Payments to be made in three installments aligned with project milestones.  
- CTBTO tax exemption applies; prices are net of VAT.

**Invoicing Policies**  
- Invoices will be issued upon completion of each milestone, payable within 30 days.

---

### Company Experience & Past Performance

**Previous Projects**  
- Successfully completed multiple borehole projects globally, including complex sites in remote and environmentally challenging areas.
- Notable project: Seismic station upgrade in Senegal for CTBTO in 2015.

**Certifications and Industry Expertise**  
- ISO 9001:2015 certified for quality management systems.
- Over 50 experienced engineers and technicians specialized in borehole drilling.

**Clients and References**  
- CTBTO, UNDP, World Bank projects.

---

### Compliance & Certifications

**Procurement Regulations**  
- Full compliance with CTBTO General Conditions of Contract.  
- Adherence to local Senegalese laws and international safety standards.

**Attachments & Support**  
- Valid insurance documentation, including workers' compensation and liability coverage.
- All necessary licenses and authorizations for project execution.

---

### Attachments & Supporting Documents

**Enclosed:**  
- Compliance matrices and technical specifications required by the RFQ.  
- Insurance certificates and legal certifications.  
- Detailed project diagrams and methodologies.  

Information not available in the RFQ document is to be acquired during the on-boarding phase in collaboration with CTBTO and under their guidance.

---  

**Signature:**  
[Company Representative]  
Project Manager  
CDGA Engineering Consultants Ltd

---

This proposal is prepared in strict adherence to RFQ No. 2024-108 specifications and CDGA's commitment to delivering excellence in engineering and project execution. We look forward to the opportunity to contribute to CTBTO's mission in ensuring global safety.

e3a50edf689cfe55c6ff2acb678f4bc7.return:
LETTERHEAD & INTRODUCTION

Company: CTBTO (Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization)  
Address: Vienna, Austria  
Contact Email: procurement@ctbto.org  

Dear Recipient,

We are pleased to submit this proposal in response to the Request for Quotation No. 2024-108, for services related to borehole rehabilitation and drilling as part of the BBTS station restoration project in Senegal. As an international organization dedicated to enforcing and monitoring compliance with the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty, CTBTO ensures that all projects conducted under its auspices meet the highest standards. This proposal outlines our capabilities and planned approach for executing the project effectively.

PROJECT SCOPE

The project encompasses two primary components:

1. Lot 1: Rehabilitation of the Existing Borehole
- Cleaning the borehole
- Sealing and cementing the casing
- Performing a pressure test to ensure no water entry

2. Lot 2: Drilling a New Borehole
- Drilling a new borehole to house a seismic instrument
- Casing and cementing to ensure stability and water-tightness
- Conducting acceptance tests including verticality, obstruction, and leak tests

EXCLUSIONS

This proposal does not cover:
- Cost of any unexpected geological changes
- Any site-specific construction unrelated to the perimeter of borehole drilling and rehabilitation

DELIVERABLES

- Comprehensive Drilling Report detailing activities, issues, and test results
- Accounts of borehole verticality, leak tests, and obstruction tests
- Monitoring and remedial actions post-project as required

COMMERCIAL

Cost Breakdown and Payment Terms:
| Description                     | Cost Estimate (USD) | Payment Terms |
|--------------------------------|-------------------|----------------|
| Lot 1: Borehole Rehabilitation | Estimated upon contract | 30% upfront, 70% on completion |
| Lot 2: New Borehole Drilling   | Estimated upon contract | 30% upfront, progress-based |

SCHEDULE

Timeline and milestones:
- Lot 1 completion anticipated within 6 weeks post contract award
- Lot 2 completion within 12 weeks, including acceptance testing and adjustments as necessary
- Weekly reviews and progress reports

COMPLIANCE

All operations will adhere to local laws in Senegal. Comprehensive insurance coverage will be maintained to cover all operational risks, as stipulated by CTBTO and United Nations guidelines. The exemption applied to CTBTO will be pursued for tax efficiencies.

EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

CTBTO has an established track record of successful projects regarding nuclear compliance and monitoring, having completed previous borehole installations and monitoring tasks globally. Our team includes experts with specialized experience in drilling and cementation processes, ensuring adherence to rigorous technical standards.

CONCLUSION & SIGN-OFF

We trust that this proposal illustrates CTBTO’s commitment to excellence and capability in fulfilling the requirements of the RFQ. We are confident that our experience, coupled with a robust project plan, will contribute significantly to the success of the BBTS station project. Please find attached all required documentation for your review.

Respectfully,

[Authorized Person's Name]  
[Title, CTBTO]  
[Contact Information]  

Note: The required additional documents are assumed to include insurance certificates, detailed resumes of key personnel, and previous project summaries. As these are not specified within the provided data, exact lists are unavailable. Please advise if additional specifics are required.
